Name: Pool Corporation
Name_1: 'We paid for finished product that isn't finished' as Mitchell Indoor Aquatic Center shut down for repairs
Text_1:
MITCHELL ‚Äî Once again Mitchell‚Äôs Indoor Aquatic Center is out of commission.

Throughout the past month the multimillion-dollar pool has been a construction site instead of a recreation opportunity like it was built for in 2018.

Mitchell Mayor Bob Everson said the latest issue that's caused the pool closure is due to the surfacing that‚Äôs been "falling apart.‚Äù

‚ÄúThere is a coating that is kind of like a plaster and it‚Äôs been coming off in areas around the pool. Water was getting in behind it and causing more to come off‚Äù Everson said of the surfacing problems. ‚ÄúWe have completely taken the old surface off the competition and the recreation pool. We‚Äôre down to the old concrete base. We are evaluating why it was delaminating to figure out what the issue is.‚Äù

The 22635-square-foot facility that sits next to the Recreation Center is in its fourth year of existence and there have already been a handful of structural issues that have prompted city officials to close the pair of pools for repair work.

ADVERTISEMENT

Considering the pool project came with an $8 million price tag Everson said the ongoing problems with the Indoor Aquatic Center are frustrating. As he put it ‚ÄúThe city paid for a finished product that isn‚Äôt finished.‚Äù

Puetz Build + Design was the contractor tabbed to oversee the construction of the new pool in 2018. Puetz selected Acapulco Pools a Canada-based company with over four decades of experience in concrete pool building to take on the construction of the leisure and competition pools. MSH Architects also had a hand in the design of the project.

Mark Puetz CEO of Puetz said the issue with the plaster surfacing is currently being repaired. The plaster that was applied by a subcontractor to the pool surfacing is also under warranty according to Puetz.

While there was plenty of excitement when the new aquatic facility was being built the finished product experiencing problems early on wasn't exactly what some city leaders hoped for. In the first year of operation Everson said plaster along the pool surfaces began experiencing problems and delaminating.

‚ÄúThe initial delamination began when the pool was under the first year of the warranty‚Äù Everson said.

The competition pool inside the Indoor Aquatic Center sits empty while crews repair the surfacing issues. Adam Thury / Mitchell Republic

Initially the repair work was anticipated to take roughly a month according to a July memo from the Parks and Recreation Department. However that changed when crews began working on the surfacing.

‚ÄúPuetz Construction went forward looking at things and found out that this might be a little bit of a bigger issue than we initially thought‚Äù Everson said.

News Mitchell's aquatic center construction on track Three years after the Mitchell City Council approved the project the city's $8 million indoor aquatic facility is taking shape. Walls are beginning to rise from the construction site just south of the Mitchell Recreation Center on North Main Str...

The Parks and Recreation Department notified the public this week of the new issues discovered in the pool in an apologetic-toned memo stating ‚ÄúGetting these issues corrected will unfortunately take more time than was originally anticipated.‚Äù

ADVERTISEMENT

Who is on the hook?

As crews have been working on repairing the pool for over a month who will be on the hook for footing the bill? And what‚Äôs the cost of the latest repair work?

City Attorney Justin Johnson said he‚Äôs been working through the process of establishing how the costs of repair work will be paid. In addition Johnson said the details of the pool warranties ‚Äî which are written agreements that promise a manufacturer of a product will repair or replace it for a respective purchaser ‚Äî are also in the process of being worked out.

Puetz said the ongoing repair work that's being done on the pools will be covered by contractors.

The totality of repair work and costs have yet to be determined Everson noted. Regardless of the final costs when the repairs are wrapped up Everson emphasized that the city should have ‚Äúno financial duty‚Äù to pay for any of the work.

‚ÄúWe paid for a perfectly good pool and we‚Äôre not getting a perfectly good pool. Therefore the city has no financial duty to pay for this‚Äù Everson said.

The indoor aquatic center has seen a fair share of use among swimmers since opening according to city officials. The competition pool also serves as the home pool of the Dakota Riptide swimming club that consists of Mitchell and Huron area competitive swimmers. But the avid pool-goers have been without the indoor aquatic facility for a little over a month.

Lifeguard Claire Lepke watches over the swimmers practicing with their kickboards in the lap pool at the Mitchell Indoor Aquatic Center. Republic

The longer the pool is shut down the longer it eliminates its ability to generate any revenue.

Although the addition of the pool was met with strong support among city leaders the project had its fair share of opponents when the aquatic facility was proposed in 2015 by the Mitchell Aquatic Club ‚Äî a group that has since merged with Dakota Riptide.

ADVERTISEMENT

The Mitchell City Council approved the funding package in August 2015 but the decision was referred by residents to a special election. The project narrowly passed later that year with 54% of voters casting ballots to approve it. A total of 2653 ballots were cast during the special election for the pool project marking less than 30% of Mitchell‚Äôs voters at the time.

The project was funded with $4.8 million in city surplus funds along with $750000 from community project reserves. A loan payment of $500000 from the Mitchell Area Development Corporation and contributions from the Mitchell Aquatic Club and increased Business Improvement District taxes covered the final $2 million. The city is on pace to have the indoor aquatic center completely paid off in 2023.

As for when the pool will reopen Everson said it‚Äôs yet to be determined adding that it hinges on how the investigation into the surfacing issues concludes.

‚ÄúIt may not be an easy fix or it may not be a hard fix. We don‚Äôt know yet‚Äù Everson said. ‚ÄúThey are working towards getting it done to meet the pool standards and city‚Äôs standards.‚Äù

Name_3: UBS Wealthfront Call Off Merger
Text_3:
UBS Group AG and robo advisor Wealthfront Inc. have agreed to scrap their planned $1.4 billion merger the companies said on Friday.

UBS announced the deal for Wealthfront in January as a way to tap into a pool of mass affluent and next-generation investors. The Swiss bank will instead be providing almost $70 million in financing for Wealthfront at the same $1.4 billion valuation.

‚ÄúI am incredibly excited about Wealthfront‚Äôs path forward as an independent company‚Äù Wealthfront Chief Executive David Fortunato said in an announcement.

A spokesman for UBS did not immediately return a request for additional comment. UBS Group Chief Executive Ralph Hamers on the company‚Äôs July earnings call said the deal was still on course.

‚ÄúUBS remains committed to its growth plans in the US and will continue the build-out of its digital wealth management offering‚Äù the company said in a separate statement late Friday about the abrupt halt of the deal.

The Swiss bank in July named Naureen Hassan a veteran wealth executive who worked on digital advice at Charles Schwab Corp. and Morgan Stanley to be president of UBS Americas effective October 3.

‚ÄúWe have an ambitious plan for the U.S.‚Äù Hamers said at the time. ‚ÄúNot only for the digital proposition but also to support the financial advisors as crucial and Naureen brings that experience.‚Äù

The company‚Äôs second quarter earnings fell short of analyst expectations a period that Hamers called one of the ‚Äúmost challenging‚Äù for investors in a decade.

UBS Wealth USA had its own digital advice offering through SigFig Wealth Management. Executives had said the Wealthfront deal would compliment its retirement services and corporate stock plan business offerings in the U.S.

UBS‚Äôs Wall Street competitors have been pushing into the self-directed market including Morgan Stanley with its 2020 purchase of E*Trade Financial and Merrill Lynch with its consumer-bank based Merrill Edge unit. JPMorgan Chase is rolling out a call center-based advice offering for customers with at least $25000.

Wealthfront had around $27 billion in assets under management and 470000 clients at the time the deal was announced. It said in the statement on Friday that it expects to be ‚Äúcash flow positive‚Äù and profitable in the next few months.

‚ÄúThank you all for continuing on this journey with us‚Äù Fortunato wrote.

Name_5: New 240-unit apartment building to be built in Raleigh's warehouse district
Text_5:
Plans for a new mixed-used development building in downtown Raleigh's warehouse district were made public on Friday by Kane Realty Corporation.

The company said they submitted plans to the city to build 240 apartment units 4000 square feet of retail space and a parking deck at the corner of South West Street and West Cabarrus Street.

According to a spokesperson with Kane Realty these units would be "luxury apartments." The estimated cost of rent has not yet been determined.

The building will have five levels of apartments two levels of parking and a ground floor of retail space according to a press release from Kane Realty.

Residents of the building will have access to co-working spaces a fitness center a pool and a sky lounge.

The Platform Kane Realty Corporation

This is the company's second project in downtown Raleigh's warehouse district. A 442-unit apartment building with some retail space in Raleigh's west end is expected to open in January 2024.

In part of the group's plan to build the 442-unit apartment building they are also building sidewalks to make Raleigh's west end more walkable.

Kane Realty is a well-known developer in the area. The group is responsible for building the Bank of America tower along Six Forks Road along with several other apartments and offices in North Hills.

Text_1: ERROR: Article `download()` failed with 403 Client Error: Forbidden for url: https://www.pfonline.com/news/ppgs-2023-color-of-the-year-expected-to-influence-industrial-design on URL https://news.google.com/articles/CBMiYWh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LnBmb25saW5lLmNvbS9uZXdzL3BwZ3MtMjAyMy1jb2xvci1vZi10aGUteWVhci1leHBlY3RlZC10by1pbmZsdWVuY2UtaW5kdXN0cmlhbC1kZXNpZ27SAQA?hl=en-US&gl=US&ceid=US%3Aen
Name_2: PPG's Vining Ivy 2023 Color of the Year expected to influence industrial design
Text_2:
Pittsburgh-based PPG has announced that its 2023 Color of the Year Vining Ivy is expected to shape the styling direction of industrial and consumer products including cookware consumer electronics and office furniture. PPG also announced a collection of three coordinating color palettes called Reflection.

Vining Ivy reflects the continued global dominance of green. It is the second consecutive year that PPG selected a shade of green and the third in the past five years.

PPG color stylists chose Vining Ivy after a comprehensive review of top trends from industries that include automotive electronics architectural building applications and fashion across 10 global regions.

‚ÄúWe are seeing green on a broader range of product applications than ever before‚Äù said Vanessa Peterson PPG global color styling leader Industrial Coatings. ‚ÄúWe felt compelled to recognize its ongoing influence with the 2023 selection because it has infiltrated the market in such a strong and powerful way.‚Äù

PPG‚Äôs color stylists believe that the dominance of the hue is reflective of the continued interest in biophilic design which is a trend that incorporates nature into everyday lives and spaces.

Name: Principal Financial Group
Name_1: Weekly roundup of people news Sept 2 | Moves
Text_1:
Former ESG head from GPIF join IFRS sustainability board; CIC chair of the board of supervisors departs; Prudential Hong Kong appoints Lawrence Lam as CEO; Chubb Life Hong Kong appoints new president; AustralianSuper promotes Daniel Lim to investment director; BlackRock makes two key hires in Asia; and more.

FORMER GPIF ESG HEAD JOINS IFRS SUSTAINABILITY BOARD

Hiroshi Komori

Hiroshi Komori former head of stewardship and ESG for Japan's Government Pension Investment Fund (GPIF) is one of three appointments to the International Sustainability Standards Board according to its parent organisation IFRS Foundation. Komori was senior director and head of GPIF‚Äôs stewardship and ESG division until March 2022.

Komori joined GPIF in December 2015 and became head of stewardship and ESG in 2016 building up ESG related practices and expertise for the pension fund. Prior to GPIF Komori was with Sumitomo Trust Bank (currently Sumitomo Mitsui Trust Bank) for over 25 years in the investor relations and shareholder relations consulting service group.

Also appointed were Jenny Bofinger-Schuster senior vice president for sustainability and operational excellence with Siemens and Veronika Pountcheva senior vice president of corporate responsibility for German corporation Metro.

IFRS Foundation trustees chair Erkki Liikanen said in a news release that the latest appointments give ISSB a geographically balanced board with a broad range of expertise as it works to develop standards for corporate sustainability disclosures.

CIC CHAIR OF BOARD OF SUPERVISORS HU HAO DEPARTS

Hu Hao

As per a decision rendered by the China's State Council Hu Hao will no longer serve as China Investment Corporation‚Äôs (CIC) chair of board of supervisors.

‚ÄúCIC highly appreciates the stellar job Mr Hu has done during his tenure to revamp the board of supervisors enhance the role of auditing in supervision and deepen internal reforms‚Äù CIC said in an announcement on August 16.

CIC‚Äôs board of supervisors is responsible for monitoring the business practices and professional ethics of the company‚Äôs directors and executives. It is also responsible for conducting internal audits and monitoring the company‚Äôs finances to ensure high quality financial management and reporting.

Hu joined CIC as chair of board of supervisors from the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China in February 2020 where he was the deputy governor.

CIC did not reply to requests for comments.

PRUDENTIAL HONG KONG APPOINTS LAWRENCE LAM AS CEO

Lawrence Lam

Prudential Hong Kong has appointed Lawrence Lam as its chief executive officer. This appointment is with effect from August 25 the life insurer announced the same day.

Lam replaced Derek Yung who completed his term in June after joining in 2009 as the Hong Kong CEO. Yung has since assumed a group advisory role at Prudential the firm told AsianInvestor.

Lam will be responsible for driving the growth and development of Prudential‚Äôs life and general insurance in Hong Kong. He reports to Lilian Ng managing director strategic business group Prudential plc.

Prior to joining Prudential Hong Kong Lam was the chief executive of Citi‚Äôs consumer banking business in Hong Kong. During his time with Citi Lawrence held multiple senior leadership positions and played a critical role in building the bank‚Äôs insurance business through bancassurance partnership.

READ ALSO: Prudential hires new group CIO based in Singapore

CHUBB LIFE HONG KONG APPOINTS NEW PRESIDENT

Belinda Au

Chubb has appointed Belinda Au president of Chubb Life Hong Kong subject to regulatory approval. She joins Chubb Life from Sun Life Financial where she served as chief executive officer Singapore.

In her new role Au will have executive operating responsibility for the company's life insurance business in Hong Kong including the integration of the long-term insurance business in Hong Kong which Chubb acquired from Cigna on July 1. Au will also take on broader responsibilities within the North Asia region to be announced in due course.

Au will report to Bryce Johns senior vice president at Chubb Group and president of Chubb Life.

Au was previously general manager of distribution and marketing at Sun Life Hong Kong. Earlier in her career Au held senior leadership roles in distribution and marketing in Hong Kong and Shanghai with AIA and Manulife.

AUSTRALIANSUPER PROMOTES DANIEL LIM TO INVESTMENT DIRECTOR

Daniel Lim

AustralianSuper has promoted Daniel Lim to the position of investment director for private credit with effect from August. He will be based in the fund‚Äôs New York office.

In his new role Lim will be focused on high yield and subordinated debt financing for real estate and infrastructure in North America.

Lim has been with AustralianSuper for the last four years as an associate director for real assets alternative debt. Prior to that he held roles at BNP Paribas Corporate and Institutional Banking and Bank of America.

TEMASEK-BACKED PENTAGREEN CAPITAL APPOINTS CEO

Pentagreen Capital the sustainable infrastructure debt financing company formed by HSBC and Temasek has named Marat Zapparov as chief executive officer as of Tuesday (August 30).

Zapparov joins from IFC where he was the head of Asia project development and investment. He will continue to be based in Singapore for the role.

Pentagreen Capital is a newly created sustainable infrastructure debt financing company formed by HSBC and Temasek which have each committed a combined $150 million of equity to deploy into sustainable infrastructure projects in Southeast Asia. The platform aims to make over $1 billion of loans within five years.

The firm‚Äôs primary focus will be on clean transport renewable energy and energy storage water and waste management.

Pentagreen will operate independently from HSBC and Temasek. Its board of directors include Zapparov Kai Nargolwala who is also board chair of Singapore Pools and 65 Equity Partners Stuart Lea and Kelvin Tan from HSBC and Connie Chan managing director of investment and financial services at Temasek.

BLACKROCK HIRES TWO NEW KEY POSITIONS IN ASIA

BlackRock has named Elaine Wu as managing director APAC head of research for BlackRock sustainable investing (BSI APAC) and Geir Espeskog as head of wealth for Southeast Asia.

Elaine Wu

In this newly created role Wu will oversee BlackRock's sustainability research across the Asia-Pacific region and report to Emily Woodland head of BlackRock sustainable investing for APAC. She will be based in Hong Kong and her appointment is already in effect according to a company news release on August 29.

Geir Espeskog

Wu was most recently head of Asia ex-Japan ESG and utilities equity research at JP Morgan where she was first to spearhead ESG research for the firm. She has more than 14 years of experience in equity research in APAC.

Hannah Lee has since assumed Wu's former responsibilities at JP Morgan in a new role as head of Asia Pacific ESG equity research at JP Morgan effective from September 1st a spokesperson for the firm told AsianInvestor.

Meanwhile Espeskog will start his newly created position in early October and is based in Singapore. His appointment signals the firm‚Äôs commitment to deepening the resources available to this fast-growing set of investors and reflects continued momentum in the wealth space which has been spearheaded by Guilherme Lima who was named head of wealth for APAC in October 2021.

Espeskog has been with BlackRock since 2010 and he has held a variety of roles building including building the firm‚Äôs iShares business in both EMEA and APAC. Most recently he was co-head of sustainable investing for APAC a role which has now been succeeded by Emily Woodland.

ALLIANZ GI APPOINTS APAC COO

Khalil Soubra

Allianz Global Investors (AllianzGI) has appointed Khalil Soubra as chief operating officer (COO) Asia Pacific while based in Hong Kong the firm announced on Monday (Aug 29).

To better align with the firm‚Äôs current and future business requirements in the fast-growing region the role of COO has been reinstated to oversee the firm‚Äôs overall operations in Asia Pacific the firm said.

In this role Soubra will report to Alexandra Auer global chief operating officer at Allianz Global Investors.

Soubra joined AllianzGI in 2003 and held various positions across different functions within the organisation. Prior to his current role he was global head of trade and position life cycle team since 2018 responsible for overseeing day-to-day operations and business performance activities related to core middle office functions including trade support corporate actions proxy voting cash and securities reconciliations and treasury cash management.

HONG HAO JOINS GROW INVESTMENT GROUP‚ÄôS HK OFFICE

Hong Hao

Former BOCOM International head of research and chief strategist Hong Hao who resigned in early May after his bearish reports on China has joined Shanghai-based alternative asset manager GROW Investment Group as its chief economist and head of research Hong announced on his social media on Wednesday (Aug 31).

Based in Hong Kong Hong will help the firm build its Hong Kong office and provide investment strategies to institutional and ultra-high net worth investors. He started the new role on Monday.

GROW was founded in Shanghai in June 2021. Navigator Global Investments is its major strategic investor. GROW opened its Beijing and Hong Kong office in December 2021 and established a multi-family office in February this year.

Hong has over 20 years of experience in the financial industry serving strategist roles in institutions including CICC Citi and Morgan Stanley.

Before joining GROW Hong was with BOCOM International for over 10 years. He is well known in the industry for his accurate forecasts of China‚Äôs economy and the stock market. He is also outspoken on domestic and international media as well as social media.

After his bearish reports on the Chinese economy in April Hong‚Äôs Chinese social media accounts were shut down. He resigned from BOCOM International shortly after. Although it is unclear which of his remarks crossed the line it happened during a time when China was censoring speech on Covid lockdowns and their impact on the economy.

Around the same time HSBC‚Äôs renowned chief economist Qu Hongbin who‚Äôs based in Hong Kong also left in May after over 20 years at the bank.

AXA IM APPOINTS CHINA COUNTRY MANAGER

Pierre-Axel Margulies

AXA Investment Managers (AXA IM) has appointed Pierre-Axel Margulies as country manager in China and a member of the board of the Chinese joint venture (JV) AXA SPDB Investment Managers.

In addition Terence Lam managing director head of client group core Asia Pacific will also become a member of the board of the Chinese JV.

Based in Shanghai and reporting to Marco Morelli executive chair of AXA IM Margulies will represent AXA IM‚Äôs interest in the Chinese JV AXA SPDB Investment Managers and report on the JV‚Äôs progress.

The country manager role in China is newly created. Cheng Liao and Bruno Guilloton who were managing the relationship with AXA IM‚Äôs Chinese JV both retired earlier this year. Prior to his new role Marguiles was previously AXA IM‚Äôs strategy and corporate finance officer and the chief of staff to AXA IM‚Äôs executive chair.

PRINCIPAL GI OPEN SEOUL OFFICE HIRES KOREA HEAD

John Kim

Principal Global Investors is opening an office in Seoul to strengthen and deepen existing client relationships in South Korea. Additionally John Kim has joined the firm as managing director and head of South Korea.

Kim will help identify and develop new client relationships working closely with and reporting to Lesley Lo managing director and head of North Asia institutional sales.

Kim brings nearly 20 years of financial services experience to Principal across a wide array of disciplines including asset management business planning investor relations private credit investing and real estate acquisitions. Most recently he was managing director and head of investor relations in South Korea for LaSalle Investment Management a real estate investment management firm.

WTW FINDS NEW INSURANCE DISTRIBUTION HEAD IN CAMBODIA

Dominick Williams

Insurance brokerage and advisory firm Willis Towers Watson (WTW) has hired Dominick Williams from Cambodia‚Äôs Fortune Life Insurance as head of distribution advisory for its insurance consulting and technology (ICT) business in Asia Pacific.

Williams joined on August 1. Based in Singapore he reports to Sam Farrimond regional leader client advisory for Asia Pacific in the ICT business. Williams will lead the development and deployment of WTW‚Äôs insurance distribution plans covering all channels and integrating the ICT team‚Äôs industry experience with the company‚Äôs technology solutions and software. A WTW spokesperson declined to comment about Williams' predecessor other than saying that the person left the role in 2021.

Williams was previously chief executive officer of Fortune Life Insurance in Cambodia. He has also held senior regional leadership roles at AIA Group and Prudential.

M&G RE ANNOUNCES NEW HIRES IN SINGAPORE KOREA

Martin Seol

M&G Real Estate has appointed Martin Seol as director portfolio management and head of targeted strategy Asia Life Fund in Singapore and Daniel Cho as director acquisitions in South Korea.

Reporting to Kee Teck Leong fund manager of Asia Life Fund Seol will manage the targeted strategy - M&G‚Äôs core-plus/ value-add mandate. In addition he will work with Peter Riley head of capital solutions on separate account solutions club deals and joint ventures.

Daniel Cho

Seol‚Äôs career of over two decades spans across real estate and credit in different markets from Los Angeles to Tokyo Seoul and Hong Kong. He joins M&G from advisory firm Coral Tree and was previously the head of Asia at Bank of America Merrill Lynch Real Estate Principal Investments.

Cho will be based in Seoul and reports to Ryu Hyesik head of Korea. An industry veteran with over 15 years of experience Cho was most recently with KKR‚Äôs Asia real estate team where he managed the firm‚Äôs Korean portfolio. He has previously worked at Mapletree Ascendas and Macquarie Capital.
Name_2: Top 10 companies in the world by market cap
Text_2:
Canva

Market Cap (or market capitalization) refers to the worth of a company computed from the total value of all its shares.



BI gives an overview of the world‚Äôs top 10 enterprises in terms of their 2023 market cap.

Market Cap is an important metric in ascertaining the comparative value of firms with regard to trading opportunities. With its market capitalization of $2.596 Trillion Apple ranks as the largest company in the world in 2023 followed by some most recognizable brands like Saudi Aramco Microsoft Alphabet and Amazon.

Apple (United States) BI Apple‚Äôs market cap of $2.59 trillion places it on top of the world‚Äôs leading enterprises. The US based multinational technology company‚Äôs principal offerings include software consumer electronics and online services. Apple is counted among the Big Five IT companies along with Alphabet Amazon Meta and Microsoft. Apple‚Äôs 2022 revenue of $387.53 billion makes it the largest technology enterprise in terms of revenue. Steve Jobs Steve Wozniak.

Saudi Arabian Oil Company (Saudi Aramco) (Saudi Arabia) Saudi Arabian Oil Company (Saudi Aramco) The Saudi Arabia-based Saudi Aramco is the second largest enterprise in the world in terms of market cap at $2.112 trillion. Saudi Aramco is also counted among the largest firms in the world in terms of revenue. This firm is also the largest oil producer in the world per day. In 2020 Forbes Global 2000 ranked Saudi Aramco as the 5th largest public enterprise in the world.Saudi Arabian Oil Company (Saudi Aramco) (Saudi Arabia).



Microsoft (United States) BI The US-based Microsoft‚Äôs market cap is estimated at $2.050 trillion which makes the multinational technology corporation the third largest firm on this list. Microsoft‚Äôs best known software offerings are the Windows line of OS MS Office suite Edge web browsers and Internet Explorer. The other leading products of Microsoft are consumer electronics personal computers and other computer software. Founded in 1975 by Bill Gates and Paul Allen Microsoft is headquartered in Redmond Washington United States.



Alphabet (United States) Alphabet Alphabet Inc the parent company of Google is the fourth largest enterprise in the world by market cap at $1.343 trillion. The American multinational technology conglomerate holding company is headquartered in Mountain View California. Listed among the world‚Äôs most valuable companies Alphabet is also the third-largest technology company in the world by revenue. Alphabet was created in 2015 and became Google‚Äôs parent company also bringing many of Google‚Äôs former subsidiaries under its umbrella.



Amazon (United States) Amazon Amazon‚Äôs market cap is at $1.052 trillion which places it fifth in the list of world‚Äôs top enterprises by market cap. The principal offerings of the American multinational technology company are cloud computing e-commerce artificial intelligence and digital streaming services. Amazon is also the world‚Äôs most valued brand. Amazon started its journey in 1994 in the garage of its founder Jeff Bezos in Washington. In 2021 Amazon was also the world‚Äôs largest online retailer.



Berkshire Hathaway (United States) Berkshire Hathaway With its market cap of $717.38 billion Berkshire Hathaway occupies the sixth place among the world‚Äôs leading enterprises by market cap. Headquartered in Omaha Nebraska the American multinational conglomerate holding company has holdings in some major US-based firms. Forbes Global 2000 considers Berkshire Hathaway as the 8th largest public company in the world the largest financial services company in terms of revenue and the tenth largest conglomerate by revenue.

NVIDIA United Health Group NVIDIA is a technology company that designs and manufactures graphics processing units (GPUs) and other computer hardware. The company has a market capitalization of $648.15 billion and since its inception in 1993 NVIDIA has been a major player in the technology industry with a strong focus on graphics processing and high-performance computing. NVIDIA has its headquarters in Santa Clara California.

Meta Platforms (United States) Meta Platforms Formerly Facebook Inc Meta Platforms is a technology company that has acquired over 91 companies including WhatsApp. Meta‚Äôs market cap is $532.19 billion which puts it in the 8th place among world‚Äôs leading enterprises by market cap. Most of the firm‚Äôs acquisitions have been sort of talent acquisitions. The majority of companies that Meta acquired are located in the San Francisco Bay area. Meta has also invested in Wildfire Interactive and LuckyCal.

Johnson & Johnson - $515.33 billion Johnson & Johnson One of the world leaders in consumer packaged goods medical devices and pharmaceuticals the American multinational corporation Johnson & Johnson was founded in 1886. The company is ranked 36th on Fortune 500 list which includes the largest corporations in the US in terms of revenue. Johnson & Johnson's market cap in 2023 is $515.33 billion which places it in the 10th position among the world‚Äôs largest enterprises by market cap. The firm is also listed in the Dow Jones industrial Average.

Tesla (United States) BI US-based Tesla‚Äôs market cap is $509.24 billion which ranks at tenth on this list. The American multinational automotive and clean energy company designs and manufactures electric cars and trucks and battery energy storage solutions. Tesla is also the world‚Äôs most valuable automaker in terms of its market cap. Tesla Energy is its subsidiary company that develops and installs photovoltaic systems in the US.

In ranking the companies we have used the latest market cap data published by the CompaniesMarketCap.com. Though market value is a more comprehensive term determined by several factors connected to a company‚Äôs health and performance often the terms market cap and market value are used interchangeably.Market cap ranking of a company does not necessarily rank it in terms of its size. For instance the largest company by market cap is Apple while in terms of revenue American multinational retailer Walmart ranks as the largest company in the world.Here are the world‚Äôs top 10 companies by their market cap as of 26th April 2023.

Thursday May 9 2024



The Zacks Research Daily presents the best research output of our analyst team. Today's Research Daily features new research reports on 16 major stocks including The Procter & Gamble Company (PG) Verizon Communications Inc. (VZ) and Intuitive Surgical Inc. (ISRG). These research reports have been hand-picked from the roughly 70 reports published by our analyst team today.



You can see all of today‚Äôs research reports here >>>



Procter & Gamble‚Äôs shares have outperformed the Zacks Soap and Cleaning Materials industry over the past year (+9.9% vs. +8.3%). The company has been gaining from robust pricing and a favorable mix along with strength across segments.



Procter & Gamble has been focused on productivity and cost-saving plans to boost margins. This led to bottom line beating the consensus mark for the seventh consecutive quarter in third-quarter fiscal 2024. Consequently PG has provided an optimistic fiscal 2024 view.



However the company has been witnessing supply-chain issues higher SG&A costs higher transportation costs and rising inflation. Its significant international presence exposes it to foreign currency risks which acts as a headwind.



(You can read the full research report on Procter & Gamble here >>>)



Shares Verizon of have outperformed the Zacks Wireless National industry over the past year (+12.8% vs. +11.7%). The company has reported modest first-quarter results with the bottom line beating the Zacks Consensus Estimate but the top line missing the same. The deployment of a cloud-native container-based virtualized architecture has led to increased flexibility scalability and cost efficiency across its network.



Verizon is offering various mix and match pricing in both wireless and home broadband plans which has led to solid client additions. Focus on emerging growth services like cloud security and professional services will likely reap long-term benefits.



However lower wireline and wireless equipment revenues are major concerns. Huge promotional expenses and lucrative discounts to expand customer base are weighing on margins. High capital expenditure for continuous network upgrade and fiber deployment is a headwind. A muted guidance for 2024 is worrisome.



(You can read the full research report on Verizon here >>>)



Intuitive Surgical‚Äôs shares have outperformed the Zacks Medical - Instruments industry over the past year (+25.7% vs. +4.0%). The company ended the first quarter on a positive note beating estimates on both counts. Revenues improved year over year. The strong performance is likely to continue in 2024 on the back of continued growth in the company‚Äôs da Vinci procedure volume coupled with strong Ion procedure growth.



ISRG‚Äôs initiative to increase the pricing of procedures should also continue to aid in sales growth in 2024.Improving procedure volume along with better system placements and services across all markets will drive top-line growth this year. Launch of da Vinci SP in Europe and da Vinci 5 in U.S. market should drive system placements higher.



However ongoing supply chain constraints although easing are likely to hurt the availability of devices. Labor shortage in hospitals will likely act as a headwind to procedure growth in 2024.



(You can read the full research report on Intuitive Surgical here >>>)

Name_3: Procter & Gamble Recognizes Key Suppliers
Text_3:
Procter & Gamble has honored two nonwovens producers with its Partner of the Year Awards for 2024. These awards celebrate the impact of the company's diverse network of external business partners or suppliers and recognizes the very best with a P&G Partner of the Year Award. This award goes to suppliers that have gone above and beyond in delivering sustained value to our business and the consumers P&G serves. This year P&G also recognized a distinguished group of five suppliers with its Supplier Impact Award for their key contributions in the areas of environmental sustainability and equality and inclusion which are fundamental to marketplace success.



Nonwovens producers Gulsan Group and Sandler AG received awards. Gulsan a manufacturer of film nonwoven and tapes to P&G‚Äôs Baby Care business is based in Gaziantep Turkey. Sandler a nonwovens manufacturer based in Schwarzenbach/Saale Germany is described by P&G as a leader in the nonwoven material category enabling P&G to make continuous investments in state-of-the-art manufacturing technology online monitoring systems in production and comprehensive testing.



Additionally Nippon Shokubai a supplier of a superabsorbent polymers to baby care was one of five companies to receive the Supplier Impact Award.
Name_4: Michael Robert 'Mike' Procter - Obituary -
Text_4:
February 6 2024

In Loving Memory ~

It is with very heavy hearts that we announce the passing of Michael (Mike) Robert Procter 79 of 150 Mile House BC on February 6 2024.

In North Vancouver BC Mike was the first of three children born to Mary and Peter Procter. Mike grew up in Williams Lake BC after the family moved there in 1951.

After graduating school he followed in his father's footsteps by becoming an Electrician. Working for his father's company Procter Electric he worked throughout the Cariboo-Chilcotin and Mike and his father were instrumental in creating novel systems to generate electricity at remote ranches and locations throughout the region.

He moved on to working in the industrial sector and became highly skilled in his trade. High in demand he worked in the construction of new sawmills and in various plants all throughout BC. Later he worked at several local sawmills and contracted throughout the area.

Over all those years Mike made many friendships that endured for the rest of his life.

He went on to marry Cheryl Midnight and they had two children Chris and Jody.

Mike had a penchant for fast cars nice trucks and fine guns. He enjoyed hunting fishing and classic car restoration. He traveled to horse shows throughout BC AB and briefly the US winning many trophies with their champion Arabian show horse Star-Sirza.

In the mid-80's Mike met his life partner Betty Johnson and in the 90's they settled in the 150 Mile area. Mike and 2 good friends purchased the 150 Mile Hotel a rich piece of history in the Cariboo. Together they revived it into the 150 Mile Roadhouse & Pub. For years the establishment was a notable and lively gathering place where many good times were had.

Mike was a hardworking generous man who was always willing to help his friends and family.

He had a great sense of humour he was always up to something and he was entertaining to be around. Throughout his life he was fortunate to have made many friends many acquaintances and to have many great stories to tell. Mike will be sorely missed by his family and friends.

Mike was predeceased by his parents Mary and Peter and his stepfather John Ailport.

He is survived by his life partner Betty brother Chris (Sherri) sister Andrea son Chris (Jenica) daughter Jody (Joey) stepson Bryan (Dawn) three nieces (Susie Mia and Alison) five grandchildren (Jayden Utah Talon Pyper and Keyfer) and many friends.

Mike wished for his ashes to be spread at his favorite mule deer hunting spot a beautiful area overlooking the Fraser River.

At Mike's request there will be no service.

Name: Progressive Corporation
Name_1: Best Gap Insurance Companies
Text_1:
Beyond the basic types of auto insurance there‚Äôs a special coverage type you may want to consider if you‚Äôre financing or leasing your car called gap insurance.

New automobiles start to depreciate in value the moment your car leaves the lot. If you sell your car even after owning it for just a year its resale value is typically as much as 20% less than its original value according to the Insurance Information Institute or Triple-I. While supply chain issues in the US are shaking up this calculus (meaning in some cases you could make a profit on a used car right now) it‚Äôs still an accurate rule of thumb.

That sudden depreciation means that if you‚Äôre financing or leasing your new vehicle there may be a time where the amount you owe on the car is greater than the market value of the car itself. For example you may owe $9000 on your car loan but find your car‚Äôs depreciated value is now only $7000. In this case if your car gets totaled you‚Äôre on the hook for paying more than the car is actually worth to cover your auto loan.

What about car insurance? Although your auto insurance policy would likely kick in if this happened the standard insurance policy would only pay for your vehicle‚Äôs current value which means there‚Äôs still a sum of money -- a gap -- you‚Äôd be obliged to pay. Gap insurance can protect you in this situation.

For more on car insurance be sure to check out our list of the best car insurance companies and best companies for cheap car insurance.

What is gap insurance and when do you need it?

Sometimes referred to as loan or lease payoff insurance gap insurance can cover the difference between your vehicle‚Äôs market value and the amount you owe on it in the event of an accident that totals your car.

If you‚Äôre leasing your vehicle this coverage is typically required according to Mark Friedlander director of corporate communications at Triple-I. But if you‚Äôre financing your vehicle it‚Äôs voluntary. So how do you decide whether you should get it?

Here‚Äôs a good rule:

‚ÄúIf you put down less than a 20% payment on your car and you‚Äôre financing the rest of it -- at least 80% -- throughout four or five years or longer that‚Äôs criteria for gap insurance‚Äù Friedlander said. ‚ÄúAdditionally our recommendation is that you purchase gap insurance through your auto insurer versus buying it from the car dealer or leasing company. The latter is more expensive.‚Äù

Buying gap insurance through your current auto insurance company may be difficult however because not all carriers offer gap insurance. In fact many major national insurers like Geico USAA and State Farm don‚Äôt.

If you‚Äôre financing or leasing a new car here‚Äôs a list of major insurers that offer gap insurance coverage.

Allstate View Rates Allstate is one of the oldest and largest car insurers in the US founded in 1937 and ranks fourth in total market share in the US according to the National Association of Insurance Commissioners. This insurance giant includes gap insurance in its robust list of coverage options though this coverage tends to come at a pricier premium compared to other insurers. While it services all 50 states and Washington D.C. it doesn‚Äôt offer gap insurance in New York. Progressive View Rates Progressive offers something similar to gap insurance called ‚Äúloan/lease payoff insurance.‚Äù It works in much the same way as gap insurance covering the difference between your vehicle‚Äôs market value and the amount you owe on it. The main difference is that Progressive‚Äôs payoff coverage is limited to no more than 25% of your vehicle‚Äôs actual cash value though the limit varies by state. For example if your car is worth $5000 and is totaled in an accident and you owe $7000 Progressive would cover $1250. Progressive offers middle-of-the-line rates generally making it potentially a good option to include in your search if you‚Äôre looking for a carrier with gap insurance (or something similar enough). Amica View Rates Amica is another major US insurer operating in every state except Hawaii. Amica is known for its high customer satisfaction scores with residents in New England noting particularly positive experiences with the carrier‚Äôs service. The insurer provides more than just car insurance policies; it also offers flood condo life home and small business insurance. If you buy gap insurance at Amica it will show up on your bill as ‚Äúauto loan/lease coverage.‚Äù This coverage isn‚Äôt available in all states. Nationwide View Rates Nationwide‚Äôs gap coverage costs approximately 5% of the total cost between both comprehensive and collision on the customer‚Äôs policy according to a Nationwide spokesperson. This carrier sells gap coverage in all states except New York and it operates in all states except Alaska Hawaii and Louisiana. To purchase this coverage you must request it within six months of buying or leasing your new vehicle and hold both comprehensive and collision coverage. Gap insurance at Nationwide is available until the vehicle turns six years old. Liberty Mutual View Rates Liberty Mutual headquartered in Boston Massachusetts is another major carrier that provides gap insurance. The carrier offers auto home and life insurance policies in all 50 states plus Washington D.C. making Liberty Mutual‚Äôs gap coverage one of the most accessible across the country. That noted the carrier receives a high number of complaints nationally filed with the National Association of Insurance Commissioners and below average scores in J.D. Power customer satisfaction surveys. The Hartford View Rates The Hartford offers a list of car insurance coverage that includes gap insurance. But this carrier isn‚Äôt for all drivers. The Hartford‚Äôs auto policy is geared towards drivers over the age of 50 who are members of the American Association of Retired Persons. Along with gap insurance Hartford also offers car replacement coverage which will give you money for a new car of the same make and model if your car is totaled instead of paying out the depreciated value of your car.

Gap Insurance FAQs

FAQs

Can you get gap insurance from a different company than your main insurance provider? Yes but it‚Äôs much more expensive. The other option if you‚Äôre not getting it through an insurer is to buy gap insurance through the lender or dealership you bought the car with. Again this is more expensive than getting it through your main insurance provider as an add-on to your policy.

Do I need gap insurance if I have full coverage? Yes. If you want to insure the gap between your car‚Äôs market value and the amount you owe on it you‚Äôll need gap insurance. Full coverage won‚Äôt cover that gap on its own.

Can you add gap insurance to your policy at any time? No. More often than not you‚Äôll need to add gap insurance immediately or soon after buying your new car. For example Nationwide requires that you buy gap insurance within six months of getting a new car.

Methodology

CNET reviews insurance carriers and products by exhaustively comparing them across set criteria. For auto insurance we examine average annual premium rates for full coverage consumer complaints collision repair scores the carrier‚Äôs financial strength auto claims satisfaction and overall customer satisfaction. Our data comes from a multitude of sources.

Auto insurance rates come from Bankrate which gathers data using Quadrant Information Services. We also use both J.D. Power annual surveys that collect data on customer auto claims satisfaction and overall customer satisfaction.

Consumer complaints are taken from the National Association of Insurance Commissioners (NAIC) which collects consumer complaints across states indexing complaints on a scale that takes into account the industry average. We collect the financial strength rating of each carrier from the A.M. Best Rating. Lastly we collected collision repair scores from the Crash Network Insurer Report Card which collects data from collision repair professionals including mechanics to gauge the quality of collision claims service from insurance carriers.

For this gap insurance list we confirmed with major insurers on the availability of gap insurance and the details of that coverage.

More car insurance advice
Name_2: Atlas World Group acquires Progressive Transportation
Text_2:
Atlas Logistics a subsidiary of Atlas World Group (CCJ Top 250 No. 63) has acquired Progressive Transportation Inc. of Wausau Wisconsin a provider of over-the-road pad-wrap transportation. Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

The acquisition of 50-truck Progressive Transportation accelerates the growth of padded-van solutions within Atlas Logistics‚Äô service offerings and delivers additional capacity to our network of agents across the company said Phil Wahl president and COO of Atlas Logistics.

‚ÄúThe timely decision was founded upon the principle of diversification" Wahl added "laying a foundation for organizational advancement as guided by the aggressive goals outlined in Atlas World Group‚Äôs Strategic Roadmap Vision 2025. It is with great pride and excitement that we welcome Progressive Transportation to the Atlas family.‚Äù

Founded in 1995 Progressive Transportation has built lasting relationships with its customer base including Progressive‚Äôs two largest clients having worked with the company for more than two decades. The executive management team has more than 30 years of experience in the transportation field and more than 25 years in the pad-wrap market.

By providing up-to-date assets including a fleet of late-model tractors and fostering an environment of openness and transparency between all employees and contractors Progressive has developed an experienced and loyal driver base.

‚ÄúThe robust logistics offerings brand power and strong industry reputation of Atlas World Group is unparalleled and gives us vast potential for growth‚Äù said Craig Olsen president of Progressive Transportation. ‚ÄúWe are thrilled to be aligned with the highest-quality logistics provider and our employees and customers will undeniably feel the benefits."

There have been 16 mergers and acquisitions among CCJ's Top 250 for-hire carriers since the beginning of June and 25 Top 250 fleets have struck 24 deals this year.
Name_3: Best Car Insurance in California: Guide to The Golden State
Text_3:
We may earn revenue from the products available on this page and participate in affiliate programs. Learn more ‚Ä∫

This article may include references to products or services where The Drive has an affiliate relationship with the providing company. The Drive and its partners may earn a commission if you purchase a product through one of our links. Read more.

Whether speeding past stately palm trees in Santa Monica or driving through the hills of San Francisco the best car insurance in California should meet your needs and fit your budget. Life in The Golden State has many benefits but unfortunately traffic gas prices and paying 60 percent more for auto coverage than the rest of the country aren‚Äôt among them. So if you‚Äôre looking to save money on car insurance in California we‚Äôve rounded up providers that blend quality protection and low premiums with a little bit of sunshine.

Best Car Insurance Companies in California

Best Value: Progressive

Best for Minimum Coverage: Geico

Best for Full Coverage: Mercury Insurance

Best for Good Driving Records: Wawanesa

Best for Poor Driving Records: The General

Best for Military Families: USAA

Insurance Companies We Recommend for Car Insurance in California

Best Value: Progressive

Insuring your car with one of the largest underwriters in the country doesn‚Äôt always mean you‚Äôll get the best deal. However Progressive has a reputation for providing quality insurance at a respectable price. In addition to standard policies Progressive offers gap coverage that pays up to 25 percent above your car‚Äôs value when it‚Äôs totaled. It will also insure custom parts and after-market upgrades. And those who purchase a collision policy will receive free pet injury insurance that covers veterinarian bills when your furry friend is hurt in a car accident.

Policyholders who opt for add-on options will pay more but this provider‚Äôs many discounts help keep insurance costs low. Progressive awards discounts for smart account management and you‚Äôll save money when you go paperless pay in full enroll in autopay sign documents digitally and purchase your policy online. Homeowners also get a discount‚Äîas do parents who add a teen driver to their policy. Even full-time students are rewarded with savings when they maintain a ‚ÄúB‚Äù average or leave their cars at home when they go off to school.

Progressive‚Äôs pay-as-you-go program Snapshot personalizes your rate based on how much you drive each billing cycle. It‚Äôs potentially a good way to save money for those who drive infrequently but need to maintain an insured vehicle. Additionally Progressive‚Äôs Name Your Price Tool will try to align your budget with a low-cost policy.

Progressive boasts above-average rankings for customer satisfaction in J.D. Power surveys and it has fewer complaints than one would expect from such a large underwriter according to the NAIC.

Pros

Usage-based insurance available

Savings with multiple discounts

Quotes available online by phone and in person

Cons

Premiums higher depending on how you buy

Not always the cheapest option

Takeaway

California drivers who prioritize quality auto insurance at a sensible price should know about Progressive. While its pricing is often in the middle of the pack perks like complimentary pet coverage and multiple money-saving discounts win this carrier the top spot for best car insurance in California.

Best for Minimum Coverage: Geico

Geico is one of the nation‚Äôs largest insurance companies and it‚Äôs acknowledged by many for providing affordable car insurance. Besides offering Californians initially competitive rates on liability-only coverage motorists may save even more money with Geico‚Äôs many discounts. You‚Äôll enjoy price reductions for having good driving habits like using a seat belt driving defensively and maintaining an unblemished motor vehicle record for five or more years.

Similarly your car‚Äôs features will also earn discounts when it's equipped with an airbag anti-lock brakes daytime running lights or an anti-theft system. Geico also discounts policyholders who are military service members Federal employees senior drivers and those who are affiliated with partnering organizations‚Äîincluding alumni associations professional networks and more. It‚Äôs these money-saving opportunities that drive down the cost of liability insurance for California drivers.

However Geico isn‚Äôt just for drivers who are only interested in minimum coverage. In fact those in the market for full coverage or add-on protections may save money on their policies too. Geico‚Äôs mechanical breakdown coverage will pay to repair all parts of a new car that is less than 15 months old and with fewer than 15000 miles. This policy can be renewed for up to seven years or 100000 miles whichever comes first. Geico will also keep your car running smoothly with its roadside assistance that pays for towing winching battery jumpstarts tire changes lockout services and fuel delivery.

J.D. Power and Associates has awarded Geico with high marks for customer satisfaction but the provider has more complaints than one would like to see according to the NAIC.

Pros

Low-cost coverage

Savings with multiple discounts

Quotes available online by phone and in person

Cons

Has complaints listed with NAIC

Few local agents

Takeaway

Californians searching for low-cost car insurance may find what they‚Äôre looking for with Geico. This carrier is well-known for providing cheap insurance rates especially for budget-conscious owners who want only minimum coverage for their vehicles.

Best for Full Coverage: Mercury Insurance

Mercury is a no-frills auto insurance provider operating in California and a handful of other states. In addition to the standard coverages one expects to see Mercury also provides 24/7 roadside assistance rental car reimbursement and ride-hailing insurance‚Äîwhich is a nice bonus for California gig workers who rideshare with their vehicles.

If you‚Äôre on the hunt for affordable full coverage insurance Mercury could be your cheapest option. You may be able to save even more with MercuryGO and RealDrive which are the provider's usage- and behavior-based programs that use an app to track both the number of miles driven and your driving habits. Motorists who drive safely and don‚Äôt log too many miles stand to save upwards of 10 percent on their premiums.

Moreover Mercury also offers customers the chance to further cut costs with multiple discounts. Policyholders with good account management practices will earn discounts for enrolling in autopay paying in full and signing documents digitally. Both good drivers and good students get rewarded with savings too‚Äîas do those who insure multiple cars install an anti-theft device and bundle their homeowner‚Äôs or renter‚Äôs insurance with Mercury.

Mercury was recognized for providing Californians with excellent customer satisfaction in the most recent J.D. Power survey but it has more complaints than expected with the NAIC.

Pros

Low-cost coverage

Savings with multiple discounts

Cons

Quotes not available online

Has complaints listed with NAIC

Takeaway

California drivers who want more than liability-only coverage have a lot to like with Mercury Insurance. This underwriter is noted for providing cheaper-than-average rates for full coverage in The Golden State.

Best for Good Driving Records: Wawanesa

Wawanesa exclusively underwrites insurance policies for experienced drivers in California and Oregon. Because of this specialization Wawanesa often undercuts the insurance rates of its larger competitors. This is especially true for good drivers with no more than one at-fault accident or moving violation in the past three years. Indeed Wawanesa prioritizes experience and only those who‚Äôve carried a driver's license for three or more years are eligible for its coverage.

This local underwriter provides all of the usual auto protections but it also offers add-ons like roadside assistance and rental car reimbursement. Plus Wawanesa will also insure after-market upgrades including custom carpeting furnishing stereo equipment rims and tires paint jobs engine accessories and anti-theft systems. It provides peace of mind for owners of wheelchair-accessible vehicles custom or vintage cars and other types of specialized automobiles.

Drivers over the age of 55 who take an approved defensive driving course can earn a discount as do those who renew their policies maintain a good driving history and insure multiple vehicles. Aside from these several savings opportunities Wawanesa doesn‚Äôt offer as many discounts as its competitors do.

Although it has an above-average number of complaints lodged with the NAIC Wawanesa is accredited by the Better Business Bureau where it maintains an A+ ranking.

Pros

Low-cost coverage for good drivers

Cons

Drivers with multiple traffic violations ineligible

Fewer discounts than most

Takeaway

Responsible drivers in California who are chasing cheap car insurance may find a friend in Wawanesa. This local insurance provider specializes in low-cost coverage for those with clean driving records but its high volume of complaints may cause some to think twice.

Best for Poor Driving Records: The General

Drivers with insurance lapses or multiple infractions on their driving records will often see their rates soar and Californians with a DUI are lucky to find a provider at all. Essentially the more risk you carry as a motorist the more likely you are to pay extra for coverage. The question is just how much extra.

The General is a non-standard insurance provider that specializes in underwriting auto insurance for high-risk drivers. Even those with more than two at-fault accidents in the past three years or a DUI-related suspension may still qualify for coverage with The General.

Keep in mind that this is not budget insurance. Rather this is second-chance auto insurance for those with few options. Still when it comes to high-premium auto insurance for repeat offenders The General‚Äôs pricing is competitive. It will even provide SR-22 forms for motorists who need to submit proof of insurance to the California Department of Motor Vehicles.

The General has a troubling amount of complaints with the NAIC but this may be par for the course considering its clientele. For what it‚Äôs worth The General does maintain a superior A+ rating with AM Best despite its volume of complaints.

Pros

Coverage for high-risk drivers

Provides SR-22 filings

Cons

High volume of complaints with the NAIC

Few discounts available

Takeaway

If at-fault accidents and moving violations have sent your car insurance premiums through the roof you may find relief with The General. Yet those with a good driving record will probably find lower rates elsewhere.

Best for Military Households: USAA

Established in 1922 to provide low-cost coverage to military households the United States Automobile Association (USAA) is technically not an insurance underwriter. Instead USAA has contracted Progressive to handle its policies. The good news is that eligible Californians will beat Progressive‚Äôs lowest price point by 5 percent. It‚Äôs one of many ways Uncle Sam thanks those who honorably serve their country.

USAA claims that its members save an average of $725 on their auto insurance when transferring their policy from another underwriter. Besides offering savings for policy bundling and smart account management this provider also discounts the premiums of motorists with a good driving record and those who complete a defensive driving course. Californians can also use the USAA SafePilot App to further discount their premiums based on driving frequency and behavior.

USAA offers the standard protections one would expect from an auto insurer and its several add-on options are nothing you wouldn‚Äôt find from similar nationwide providers. Still its focus on military families makes it a top contender for eligible drivers. It‚Äôs easy to see how USAA claims the top spot for customer satisfaction in the J.D. Power and Associates 2021 report.

Pros

Low-cost coverage

Coverage available to children spouses and former spouses of military service personnel

Cons

Coverage not available to the general public

Takeaway

Although the general public isn‚Äôt eligible for auto coverage through USAA veterans active-duty military personnel and their families will likely find the cheapest car insurance with this government-backed provider.

Average Cost of Insurance in California

By most accounts the average monthly cost of car insurance in California is generally around $50 for minimum coverage and $180 for full coverage‚Äîthat‚Äôs $600 to $2160 respectively for an annual premium.

The cost of insuring a vehicle in California is 63 percent higher than the national average of $1321 according to some sources. This dramatic difference in insurance rates between The Golden State and the rest of the country is presumably due to congested traffic and clogged motorways‚Äîboth of which lead to a higher probability of accident claims.

In addition to its dense population California is also geographically large. Hence average estimates take into consideration the costs of insuring a vehicle in overpriced Beverly Hills and affordable Fresno‚Äîtwo cities that possess vastly different auto insurance risk profiles.

Keep in mind that the price of your premium will depend largely on the value of your car your motor vehicle record and insurance claims history and other cost variables that we discuss in detail below.

How to Save on Insurance

The best way to save money on car insurance is to comparison shop. Requesting quotes from three to five companies will undoubtedly yield both the highest and lowest insurance rates.

Many owners assume prices are fairly consistent and will take the first insurance quote they get but this is a common mistake. Insurance costs vary significantly between providers because each assesses risk differently. So comparison shopping will help you save hundreds of dollars if not thousands over the life of your policy.

Plus shopping your insurance rate with multiple providers gives you leverage to negotiate. While an insurance agent is under no obligation to negotiate with you there‚Äôs nothing stopping you from asking one to beat your lowest quote.

Thankfully there are additional money-saving strategies California motorists can use to reduce the cost of their premiums. Here are a few of the more effective techniques.

Increase your deductible. Your deductible is the amount of money you pay before your underwriter will pay for damages in a claim. When you raise your deductible from $250 to $1000 you‚Äôll have to pay more out-of-pocket after an accident but you‚Äôll also cut the price on your insurance premium.

Your deductible is the amount of money you pay before your underwriter will pay for damages in a claim. When you raise your deductible from $250 to $1000 you‚Äôll have to pay more out-of-pocket after an accident but you‚Äôll also cut the price on your insurance premium. Don‚Äôt pay for coverage you won‚Äôt use. Underwriters offer a selection of appealing coverages that those on a budget can forgo such as disappearing deductibles roadside assistance gap coverage and custom parts and equipment (CPE) coverage to name a few.

Underwriters offer a selection of appealing coverages that those on a budget can forgo such as disappearing deductibles roadside assistance gap coverage and custom parts and equipment (CPE) coverage to name a few. Use a pay-as-you-go program. Many providers offer usage-based insurance that tracks your driving behavior through a telemetric device and only charges based on how much you drive. A few examples of usage-based programs are Progressive‚Äôs Snapshot Allstate‚Äôs Drivewise and State Farm‚Äôs Drive Safe & Save.

Many providers offer usage-based insurance that tracks your driving behavior through a telemetric device and only charges based on how much you drive. A few examples of usage-based programs are Progressive‚Äôs Snapshot Allstate‚Äôs Drivewise and State Farm‚Äôs Drive Safe & Save. Take advantage of discounts. Discounts are price reductions insurance companies offer to encourage loyalty and reduce driver risk. Each carrier will have their own set menu of discounts and policyholders can significantly reduce the cost of their premiums by qualifying for as many of them as possible.

Common Insurance Discounts for California Drivers

The best car insurance companies in California will offer multiple discounts to help customers lower the cost of insurance premiums. While the titles guidelines and availability of these discounts vary by provider here are common insurance discounts you‚Äôll find in California.

Safe driver: Drivers with good driving records save money and those with no at-fault accidents or motor vehicle violations will save even more.

Drivers with good driving records save money and those with no at-fault accidents or motor vehicle violations will save even more. Continuously-insured drivers: Motorists who have been insured for six months or more will be considered ‚Äúcontinuously insured‚Äù and receive a modest discount. But those who have held this status for multiple years may receive even more savings.

Motorists who have been insured for six months or more will be considered ‚Äúcontinuously insured‚Äù and receive a modest discount. But those who have held this status for multiple years may receive even more savings. Good student: Young drivers with good grades could get rewarded with lower premiums. Typically a grade-point average of a ‚ÄúB‚Äù or better will qualify for these types of discounts.

Young drivers with good grades could get rewarded with lower premiums. Typically a grade-point average of a ‚ÄúB‚Äù or better will qualify for these types of discounts. Safety features: Providers discount vehicles with safety features like anti-lock brakes and daytime running lights. Similarly policyholders who install anti-theft devices may also earn a discount.

Providers discount vehicles with safety features like anti-lock brakes and daytime running lights. Similarly policyholders who install anti-theft devices may also earn a discount. Payments and billing: Those with good account-management skills can potentially enjoy discounts for enrolling in paperless billing setting up automatic payments and paying their premiums in full.

Essential Cost Variables for Insurance

As with everything there are a host of variables that will affect the cost of your insurance as no two people are exactly alike. With that in mind here are the variables that‚Äôll change the cost of your insurance.

Age

Insurance carriers will use a policyholder‚Äôs age as a proxy for driving experience. Since young drivers and teen drivers both lack the practical knowledge of a more mature motorist they often pay higher rates early on in their driving careers.

Furthermore multiple studies have shown that younger people are not only the cause of more accidents than their older counterparts but that accidents involving young drivers are also more severe. In a recent report the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) found that 25 percent of young drivers had been involved in one or more crashes.

This increased risk translates into higher premiums. But the good news is that age-based rates begin to balance out around age 25 for most drivers provided they maintain a clean driving record. Most motorists pay the least for car insurance between the ages of 40 to 60.

Gender Credit Score and Location

In other states traits such as a motorist‚Äôs gender ZIP code and credit score are all used by insurance underwriters to estimate the risk a policyholder carries. As an example men with bad credit who live in a congested city would pay higher insurance rates than women with good credit who reside in the suburbs.

However California has laws that prevent insurance providers from using any of these traits to determine how much you‚Äôll pay for car insurance.

Vehicle/Model

Providers use details about your car to evaluate insurance costs. They will look at the make and model of your vehicle its accident rates along with its age value and safety features to establish the cost of your premiums.

Some car models including Subarus Toyotas and Hondas are often cheaper to insure than other brands. Similarly sports utility vehicles (SUVs) are also frequently more affordable to insure than pickup trucks and sports cars.

Type of Coverage

More so than any other cost variables the type of coverage its deductible and its policy limits all have a pronounced impact on the cost of your insurance premiums. These are the standard types of car insurance policies you‚Äôll find in California.

Liability: Liability is the minimum coverage required in California and this policy protects you in two ways. Bodily injury liability covers someone else‚Äôs medical costs when you‚Äôre at fault in an accident and property damage liability covers the damage to somebody else‚Äôs car also when you‚Äôre at fault.

Liability is the minimum coverage required in California and this policy protects you in two ways. Bodily injury liability covers someone else‚Äôs medical costs when you‚Äôre at fault in an accident and property damage liability covers the damage to somebody else‚Äôs car also when you‚Äôre at fault. Comprehensive: Covers your vehicle from non-accident damage such as fire theft or vandalism.

Covers your vehicle from non-accident damage such as fire theft or vandalism. Collision: Covers damage to your vehicle caused by an accident regardless of fault.

Covers damage to your vehicle caused by an accident regardless of fault. Medical payments: Covers medical costs funeral expenses and loss of wages for both you and your passengers regardless of fault.

Covers medical costs funeral expenses and loss of wages for both you and your passengers regardless of fault. Uninsured and underinsured motorist: Covers medical and property damage expenses when the at-fault motorist is inadequately insured.

FAQs

You‚Äôve got questions. The Drive has answers.

Q. How much is car insurance in California?

A. The average annual cost of car insurance in California is about $600 for minimum coverage and $2160 for full coverage. This translates to $50 to $180 for those who prefer to pay their premiums monthly. Most estimates place the annual cost of insuring a car in California to be roughly 60 percent more than the national average.

Still the cost of your insurance premium will be determined by variables such as your driving record claims history age and the value and safety of your car.

Q. Who has the cheapest car insurance in California?

A. The cheapest car insurance in California is typically Geico Mercury Wawanesa and AAA NorCal. Many authorities ballpark minimum coverage costs for older drivers is between $32 to $46 per month with any of these providers. But these premiums can be as much as four times higher for teen drivers and those with a DUI.

Mercury may have the cheapest insurance rates for full coverage and the company claims that its California customers save an average of $677 with their price points and discounts. Full coverage policies often include a blend of liability collision comprehensive medical payments and uninsured/underinsured motorist protections.

While California only requires drivers to carry liability to legally operate a car full coverage is highly recommended for those who can afford it.

Q. How much coverage do you need in California?

A. California requires motorists to carry liability insurance to lawfully drive a car. The minimum coverage requirement is 15/30/5 for bodily injury liability and property damage liability. That pays $15000 per passenger and $30000 per accident for someone else‚Äôs medical costs when you are liable for a traffic accident. It also pays up to $5000 to cover damage to their vehicle.

Bear in mind that if you purchased a vehicle with an auto loan your loan servicer will most likely insist you carry full coverage until the balance is paid. Similarly when you are leasing a car in California the dealership or rental car company may require a liability policy of 100/300/100 that pays $100000 $300000 and $100000 respectively.

Q. Is California a no-fault state?

A. No. California is an at-fault state rather than a no-fault state. This means that the motorist who is assigned fault in a traffic accident is liable for paying medical and property damage expenses sustained by the victim. On the other hand no-fault states require drivers to file claims directly through their providers after an accident regardless of fault. This is why some states require personal injury protection (PIP) and others like California do not.

Text_4:
